security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only reference materials and MCP tool definitions for Nx documentation lookup. No executable scripts, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities beyond documented examples.

content.value_statement: Nx monorepos require specialized knowledge of project graphs, affected commands, and caching strategies to optimize build performance. This skill provides expert Nx CLI commands, code generation patterns, and Python integration with uv workspaces for AI-assisted development.
actual_capabilities: Analyze project dependencies using Nx graph with JSON and focus options
Detect affected projects and run targeted builds with nx affected
Generate applications and libraries using Nx generators with dry-run preview
Configure local and remote caching via Nx Cloud for faster builds
Add Python applications to monorepos using uv workspaces
Create shared JS/TS libraries and manage cross-project dependencies
limitations: Does not execute Nx commands directly; provides documented examples only
Requires Nx to be installed in the project workspace
Does not modify project configuration files automatically
Python integration requires manual uv workspace setup

prompt_templates.title: List available generators
prompt_templates.prompt: What generators are available in the @nx/next plugin? Show me how to list them using Nx.

prompt_templates.title: Generate new application
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a new app in the workspace
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a new Next.js application called dashboard in the apps/directory directory using Nx generator. Show me the command with dry-run first.

prompt_templates.title: Find affected projects
prompt_templates.prompt: Which projects are affected by changes since main? Show me how to run build, test, and lint only on affected projects.

prompt_templates.title: Add Python to monorepo
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a Python application to my Nx monorepo using uv workspaces. Show me the complete setup including project.json configuration.

output_examples.input: What projects are affected by my changes since main?
output: Run targeted builds: npx nx affected -t build,test,lint
View dependency graph: npx nx graph --affected

best_practices: Use nx affected commands in CI to run only changed projects, reducing build times significantly
Configure cacheable targets in nx.json with proper inputs for deterministic caching
Create shared libraries for common code to enable proper dependency boundaries
anti_patterns: Running full builds instead of affected-based builds in CI pipelines
Skipping the dry-run step before generating code, which can cause unexpected changes
Not defining proper inputs for targets, breaking cache correctness

faq.question: What Nx version is required?
faq.answer: Nx 17.0 or later is recommended for full MCP support and modern features.

faq.question: How does Nx Cloud caching work?
faq.answer: Nx Cloud provides remote caching. Run npx nx connect to enable it for distributed cache hits.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides documented commands and patterns. You must run commands yourself.

faq.question: Does it support Python projects?
faq.answer: Yes. Python projects integrate via uv workspaces with manual project.json for Nx orchestration.

faq.question: What happens if Nx is not installed?
faq.answer: Install Nx globally or use npx nx to run commands. Check nx.json exists in workspace root.

faq.question: How is this different from other build tools?
faq.answer: Nx provides advanced dependency graph analysis, affected detection, and intelligent caching out of the box.
